item.title: Please don't end my year...
item.description: Let’s debunk some common misconceptions about year-end closing in Dynamics GP: Myth #1: All adjusting entries must be finalized before closing the General Ledger. This is false. Dynamics GP allows posting to the most recent historical year. After closing 2009, for instance, adjustments can still be made to it, just not to 2008. This requires enabling “allow posting to history” in GL setup and ensuring the fiscal period is open in Fiscal Period Setup.

item.title: Unusual Quick Journal Entry
item.description: A client recently encountered an unusual problem with quick journals in Microsoft Dynamics GP. It turns out this is a known issue, but the likelihood of Microsoft resolving it is low due to the small number of users affected. For those unfamiliar with quick journals, they let you create templates for journal entries that automatically balance. You provide all the details except one line, and the system calculates the remaining amount to ensure the entry balances.
